title: Liam Polwart
text:
Liam Polwart (born 2 April 1995) was a New Zealand <a href="Rugby%20Union">rugby union</a> player who currently plays as a <a href="Hooker%20%28rugby%20union%29">hooker</a> for in New Zealand's domestic <a href="Mitre%2010%20Cup">Mitre 10 Cup</a> and for the in the international <a href="Super%20Rugby">Super Rugby</a> competition.
Youth career.
Polwart attended <a href="Sacred%20Heart%20College%2C%20Auckland">Sacred Heart College</a> in Auckland and during that time was a New Zealand secondary schools Barbarians representative, he also went on to captain at under-19 level before moving to the Bay of Plenty along with New Zealand under-20 team-mates <a href="Mitchell%20Karpik">Mitchell Karpik</a> and <a href="Henry%20Stowers">Henry Stowers</a> in late 2015.
Senior career.
Polwart made his senior debut for the Bay of Plenty Steamers during the <a href="2016%20Mitre%2010%20Cup">2016 Mitre 10 Cup</a> season and went on to make 6 appearances before injury curtailed his campaign.
Super Rugby.
Despite having only made 6 senior appearances, Polwart was named in the squad ahead of the <a href="2017%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2017 Super Rugby season</a>, where he would compete with <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">All Blacks</a> <a href="Hika%20Elliot">Hika Elliot</a> and <a href="Nathan%20Harris%20%28rugby%20union%29">Nathan Harris</a> for the number 2 jersey.
International.
Polwart was a member of the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand Under-20</a> side which competed in the <a href="2015%20World%20Rugby%20Under%2020%20Championship">2015 World Rugby Under 20 Championship</a> in <a href="Italy">Italy</a>, making 5 appearances.
